prompt: Statement 1| For two random variables, the joint entropy is always at least as large as the sum of their individual entropies. A. O(1)
B. O(Q^2)

P(A, B, C, D) = P(A) * P(D) * P(C | D) * P(B | A, C) C. P(A, B, C, D) = P(A) * P(D) * P(C | D) * P(B | A) D. None of the above

Statement 1| The decision boundary of a linear SVM is determined by the support vectors. Statement 2| A linear classifier can always achieve perfect separation when data is linearly separable. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True
Which of the following is a common drawback of Maximum Likelihood Estimators (MLE)? A. They are always consistent B. They have low variance C. They are unbiased D. They can have high variance

In the context of training a neural network, which factor most significantly influences the balance between underfitting and overfitting? A. The number of layers B. The choice of activation function C. The optimization algorithm D. The batch size

During training, if the loss suddenly spikes after a few epochs, which of the following might be the cause? A. Learning rate is too low B. Learning rate is too high C. Batch size is too small D. Batch size is too large

Statement 1| The original Transformer model uses Batch Normalization. Statement 2| GANs typically use a loss function called the Wasserstein loss. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True

Statement 1| The decision boundary of a boosted model is an aggregated result of its weak learners and may differ from each individual weak learner's boundary. Statement 2| Cross-validation is useful for determining the appropriate number of boosting iterations to avoid overfitting. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True
When a model is trained with an extremely large amount of data, what is the expected behavior of its variance? A. It reduces B. It increases C. It remains constant D. It varies unpredictably

How does the number of times a model is trained change as the number of folds K increases in K-fold cross-validation? A. Increases linearly with K B. Increases quadratically with K C. Increases cubically with K D. Increases exponentially with K

You've built a decision tree for a financial fraud detection system, but it shows poor accuracy on both the training and test datasets. Assuming there are no implementation errors, what might be the cause? A. The decision tree is not deep enough. B. The learning rate is set too low. C. The model is overfitting to the data. D. None of the above.

Which of the following is NOT a common use of regression analysis? A. Forecasting future values. B. Classifying data into categories. C. Estimating relationships between variables. D. Modeling time series data.

In classification tasks, a dataset with high entropy is expected to have classes that are
A. clearly defined
B. well-mixed
C. perfectly separated
D. easily distinguishable

Statement 1| ResNet architectures can achieve over 90% accuracy on the CIFAR-100 dataset. Statement 2| Using ensemble methods with neural networks does not lead to better results due to redundancy in learned features. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True

In adjusting a neural network's architecture, which component primarily affects the model's ability to avoid both underfitting and overfitting? A. The number of hidden units B. The choice of weight initialization C. The activation function used D. The type of optimizer

Which of the following is true about the decision boundary of a linear SVM? A. It is a straight line in two-dimensional space. B. It is guaranteed to be non-linear in any kernel-based SVM. C. It can only be a curve in two-dimensional space. D. It is determined by the number of data points in the dataset.

What preprocessing step is essential in PCA to match the output of SVD? A. Subtract the mean from each feature B. Subtract the median from each feature C. Divide each feature by its range D. None of these
Statement 1| DenseNet architectures incorporate Batch Normalization. Statement 2| StyleGAN is primarily used for generating audio data. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True

Statement 1| The dropout technique does not involve initializing neural network weights. Statement 2| The softmax function is a nonlinear activation function. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True
Which of the following is a regularization technique that can be used for feature selection by setting some coefficients to zero? A. Lasso B. Linear Regression C. Logistic Regression D. Naive Bayes

Statement 1| The XLNet model was trained using a permutation-based language modeling objective. Statement 2| In 2020, MobileNets frequently used the ELU activation function. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True

A neural network has P input features, no hidden layers, one output node, and employs the Sigmoid Activation Function with Binary Cross-Entropy Loss. Which of these optimization methods (assuming correct hyper-parameters and initialization) can reach the global optimum? A. Stochastic Gradient Descent B. Mini-Batch Gradient Descent C. Batch Gradient Descent D. All of the above

Statement 1| Inception networks use multiple filter sizes to capture different spatial features simultaneously. Statement 2| The Adam optimizer was introduced before the concept of Weight Decay regularization. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True
Which algorithm is designed to handle noise and find clusters of varying densities in spatial datasets? A. K-means B. DBSCAN C. Hierarchical clustering D. Mean shift

When adapting the EM algorithm to compute Maximum A Posteriori (MAP) estimates for a Hidden Markov Model, which part of the algorithm needs to be adjusted? A. Initialization B. Transition probabilities C. Maximization D. Expectation

Statement 1| In SVM, the margin is the distance between the decision boundary and the nearest data point from any class. Statement 2| Adding more features to a model always increases its performance. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True
Which of the following algorithms is NOT used for classification tasks?

Statement 1| In 2020, some models surpassed 98% accuracy on the ImageNet dataset. Statement 2| The original AlexNet was not trained with the Adam optimizer. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True
Which of the following algorithms is used for clustering in machine learning? A. Agglomerative Clustering B. Logistic Regression C. Gradient Boosting D. Neural Network

Which of the following statements is NOT true about linear regression models? A. They can predict continuous outcomes. B. They are used for classification tasks. C. They can identify trends. D. They require a linear relationship between variables.

Statement 1| The F1 score is the harmonic mean of precision and recall. Statement 2| AUC-ROC is a metric that can be used to evaluate the performance of anomaly detection models. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True

Statement 1| K-nearest neighbors, like support vector machines, inherently provide a probability distribution over class labels. Statement 2| The choice of distance metric in K-nearest neighbors can significantly affect the model's performance. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True

When expanding a feature set with more polynomial terms, what is the expected impact on model bias? A. Bias is reduced B. Bias is increased C. Bias remains constant D. Bias and variance are unaffected

Statement 1| The softmax function is used to assign probabilities to each class in a classification problem. Statement 2| A lower temperature in the softmax function results in less certainty in the predicted class probabilities. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True

Which of the following is NOT an objective of regression techniques? A. Predicting numerical values. B. Understanding variable relationships. C. Classifying data points. D. Analyzing trends over time.
When aiming to reduce the number of features in a dataset, which technique is most suitable? A. Decision Trees B. Lasso Regression C. K-means Clustering D. Principal Component Analysis
Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of supervised learning?

Statement 1| Softmax is used to convert logits into probabilities in neural network outputs. Statement 2| A higher temperature in the softmax function results in a sharper probability distribution. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True

A dataset has five attributes plus a class. The attributes have 2, 3, 2, 4, and 2 possible values each. The class has 2 possible values. How many maximum possible different examples are there? A. 48 B. 96 C. 192 D. 384

Consider an optimization algorithm where the gradient of the objective function is computed and stored in a vector. What is the time complexity to perform a single parameter update using this gradient? A. O(D) B. O(N) C. O(ND) D. O(N^2D)
What is the rank of the following matrix? E = [[5, 5, 5], [5, 5, 5], [5, 5, 5]]

Statement 1| Autoencoders and GANs are both used for unsupervised learning tasks. Statement 2| GANs consist of a generator and a discriminator, while autoencoders consist of an encoder and a decoder. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True

Statement 1| The cumulative distribution function (CDF) of a random variable x is non-decreasing. Statement 2| Support Vector Machines (SVM) aim to maximize the margin between data points and the decision boundary. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True

While evaluating a decision tree model for classifying medical images, you observe it performs badly on both the training and test data. If the implementation is correct, what could be the reason? A. The decision tree does not have enough depth. B. The learning rate is too aggressive. C. The model is overfitting the data. D. None of the above.

Which of the following is a limitation of Grid search in hyperparameter tuning? A. It is computationally expensive for large parameter spaces. B. It requires differentiable functions. C. It can only be used with continuous functions. D. It is difficult to code.

Statement 1| The entropy of a joint probability distribution can never be less than the sum of the entropies of its marginal distributions. Statement 2| Moralization of a directed acyclic graph can result in fewer edges than the original graph. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True
What type of clustering algorithm is DBSCAN considered to be? A. Partitioning based B. Density based C. Hierarchical D. Grid based

Statement 1| Increasing the learning rate can lead to faster convergence but may cause instability. Statement 2| L2 regularization adds a penalty equal to the square of the magnitude of coefficients to the loss function. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True

In a Gaussian Naive Bayes model, which assumption significantly influences the balance between model complexity and generalization: A. Assuming uniform class distribution or estimating class distribution from data B. Using shared covariance matrices for all classes or individual covariance matrices for each class C. Estimating class means using Maximum Likelihood or Bayesian Estimation D. Assuming independence between features or allowing feature dependencies

Statement 2| Logistic regression inherently requires the assumption of equal covariance among classes, similar to Gaussian Naive Bayes. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True

A. Stochastic Gradient Descent B. Mini-Batch Gradient Descent C. Batch Gradient Descent D. All of the above

Statement 2| Combining multiple neural networks into ensembles does not enhance classification performance because they learn similar features. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True

False, True

A. well-separated
B. mixed
C. uniform
D. ordered

Statement 2| In graph theory, removing edges from a directed graph can sometimes increase the number of edges after moralization. A. True, True B. False, False C. True, False D. False, True
